intro: Fagara canalensis, commonly known as the Caribbean wax tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, waxy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Fagara canalensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
